name: Blue Rainbow ApartHotel - Edinburgh

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the Blue Rainbow Apartments in Edinburgh. The apartment was extremely clean and comfortable. The location is absolutely perfect for the city centre ( we could see the Playhouse from our lounge window on one side and Harvey Nicols from the other :-)). Staff (especially Jill the manager) were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent service at Blue Rainbow
3 times a charm
reviews.text: Will certainly recommend to friends and family.
Looking forward to our next stay!
reviews.title: Love Blue Rainbow Apartments!

reviews.text: My family and I have stayed there three times within the last few years and each stay has been no less than comfortable. The place is exceptionally clean (for the most part), spacious, and convenient. A special commendation to a member of the staff whose unflinching professionalism and welcoming manner deserve mention here; Stuart is consistently helpful and kind. In sum, we loved the place for its convenience, its sense of space, and yet its coziness, the nice little touches (like a breakfast package), and Stuart, of course! Next time we are in Edinburgh, it would definitely be our place of abode.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.text: I love the Blue Rainbow Apartments in Manchester, so on that basis I booked Edinburgh. Apart from a bit of a curry smell (still not sure why!), the place was perfect! The floor boards creak like the lovely old building it is, but if that doesn't bother you, the location, the National Portrait Gallery opposite and the rest of the space should more than make up for a little squeaking.
reviews.title: Great Place, excellent location and very friendly staff.

reviews.text: Booked this hotel as a weekend getaway for just me and my boyfriend and it was great staff very friendly told us best places to visit room was fab everything you need and great views !
reviews.title: Great hotel fantasic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had used the Manchester apartments on a number of occasions and when we saw Edinburgh advertised we decided to book for a weekend
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the receptionist(s) very friendly and really enjoyed our stay
reviews.title: Loved it loved it loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Apartments are in a central position (short walk from Waverley Station/Airlink stop)
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.text: We had an end apartment facing the gardens which kept noise to a minimum
reviews.title: Would Definitely Go Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff (very helpful), Location is great - if you rent or have a car, they have an parking on a near mall. We loved our room, very clean (it was with a little smell of paint, but that was ok).
reviews.title: excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have laundry machines, very helpfull, especially for us (on a big trip in Europe).
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A excellent choice, no doubt.
reviews.title: Terrible value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price was little expensive, but not far from the others that we searched. Worth the money.
reviews.title: Excellent Accom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PT-BR:
reviews.title: Blue Rainbow, home from home!

reviews.text: The apartment was decorated and equiped to a high standard. However, I felt more attention to detail would have resulted in a better experience all round.
reviews.title: Attention to detail would make all the difference

reviews.text: The main problem I encountered was that I had paid extra for an additional bed which was meant to be set up for us on arrival.
reviews.title: Wont be back

reviews.text: I did notice there was a put up bed with a duvet left in the corridor which I assumed was mine. I had to contact the receptionist who came up with bedding and put the bed up. Luckily we were in the apartment for the evening at 7.00pm, it would have been all the same if we came back at 2.00am and had to start messing around with beds.
reviews.title: Outstanding Aparthotel; great service and great location.

reviews.text: There was a box with a selection of tea, however, on closer inspection it was all exotic tea and again we had to contact reception to get regular tea. The breakfast was very dissapointing, weetabix and half a pint of milk between four adults, we ended up eating elsewhere. I was expecting bread for toast and jam and maybe some yoghurts. Finally there was meant to be a selction of Elemis products in the bathrooms, however, there were four body lotions instead of the selection, which meant you had to use you own products.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable

reviews.text: There was some nice extras, chololates left on the pillows, magazines on the coffee table, bath robes for all.
reviews.title: Back in Edinburgh

description: Royal Garden Apartments is Edinburgh's best located Aparthotel, offering a fantastic base from which to conduct both business and pleasure. Choose from spacious one and two bedroom apartments with a lounge/dining area, kitchen and en-suite bathrooms, or one of our two penthouse apartments each with its own balcony, perfect for a family or romantic break.
